project_abstract.cdata: In addition to construction of the Sarajevo-Ploce and Belgrade-Bar lines, the railways are carrying out a seven-year investment plan, 1964-70, which provides for capital investments of about $658 million equivalent over the seven-year period. The main items of the plan are: (1) the electrification and installation of modern signalling equipment on three main lines, (2) the construction of six new marshalling yards, (3) renewal of the permanent way, bridges and structures of the entire system, (4) purchase of locomotives and rolling stock, and (5) remodelling of stations and freight yards, and the conversion of narrow gauge to standard gauge lines.
